page.title: 14THE SAWMILL - ARRAN
page.content: The sawmill at Cladach has been in operation since 1914. Originally owned by Arran Estates it is now run by the Clark family. There is a large range of equipment including circular saws, pressure tanks, tractors and a forklift truck. All replacements come from the mainland and are shipped over by ferry. Those employed at the sawmill work 8 hours a day, 6 days a week. Two men are employed to cut the wood before it comes to the sawmill and soft woods mainly are selected. Anyone can buy the sawn wood. Most of it is sold for fencing, building and sheds. Wood is sent to Oban, Ayrshire and England but the main market is on Arran. Surplus wood is sold as fire- wood and the sawdust goes to farmers for bedding for their animals.
